original: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed de @137b bco brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed de @137b bco brgyad pa'o /
translated: This was the eighteenth chapter on the downfall of not living in the right place, belonging to “The Chapter on Downfalls and Infractions.”

original: // / srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The chapter on the downfall of using water containing living beings

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed in the Kūṭāgāraśālā in the grove of Kūṭāgāra in the city of Kauśāmbī.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang / sa la 'debs par byed /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang / sa la 'debs par byed /
translated: At that time, the venerable Saṅgharakṣita knowingly used water containing living beings to water grass, mud, and earth,

original: 'debs su 'jug par byed nas /
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug par byed nas /
translated: and he made others do the same.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod shes bzhin du /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de la smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa khyod shes bzhin du /
translated: The monks said to him,🔽“Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, knowingly do not use water containing living beings to water grass, mud, and earth, and do not make others do so.”

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang / lci ba dang / sa la ma 'debs shig 'debs su ma 'jud cig /'dun pas smras pa /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang / lci ba dang / sa la ma 'debs shig 'debs su ma 'jud cig /'dun pas smras pa /
translated: Saṅgharakṣita said,

original: kho bo la 'ga' zhig gis bgrangs te gtad dam /
analyzed: kho bo la 'ga' zhig gis bgrangs te gtad dam /
translated: “Did someone count and give it to me?

original: ci shar gyi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /
analyzed: ci shar gyi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /
translated: What’s the problem if I go to the great ocean in the east?”

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang gi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang gi rgya mtsho chen por 'dong na ci nyes /
translated: “What is wrong with going to the great oceans in the south, west, and north?”

original: 'bab chu dang mtsho dang / lteng ka dag tu 'dug na ci nyes zhes zer nas /
analyzed: 'bab chu dang mtsho dang / lteng ka dag tu 'dug na ci nyes zhes zer nas /
translated: “What is wrong with staying in streams, lakes, and ponds?”🔽The monks with few desires complained and criticized him,

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs pa dang / 'debs su 'jud par byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva dang lci ba dang sa la 'debs pa dang / 'debs su 'jud par byed ces smod par byed /
translated: “Why do the monks knowingly use water containing living beings to water grass, clay, and earth, or to have it watered?”🔽They criticized him,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /🔽dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de / dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: spread it about,🔽and told the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /🔽yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva'am lci ba'am /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du / yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva'am lci ba'am /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sa la 'debs sam /
analyzed: sa la 'debs sam /
translated: “Monks, you should not knowingly use water containing living beings to water grass, clay, or earth, or to have it watered.

original: 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If you do, you commit an offense.”

original: yul ni koo sh'amb'i /
analyzed: yul ni koo sh'amb'i /
translated: The place was in Kauśāmbī.

original: gang zag ni 'dun pa /
analyzed: gang zag ni 'dun pa /
translated: The person was Saṅgharakṣita.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bag med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bag med pa /
translated: The affliction is heedlessness.

original: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu rang spyod pa'i don las gzhan du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu rang spyod pa'i don las gzhan du spyod pa'o //
translated: The misdeed is using water that one knows contains living beings for a purpose other than the purpose for which it is intended.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In regard to that, the one who is a bhikṣu

original: 'dun pa'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: is one who is desirous or another who is like that.

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “With knowledge” means

original: de rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de rang nyid kyis rig par gyur pa'am /
translated: that one has come to know it oneself

original: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
translated: or that it has been stated by another.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “That contains living beings” means

original: srog chags dang bcas pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa ni gnyis te /
translated: that there are two kinds of living beings:

original: gang dag mig gis mthong bar gyur pa dang / gang dag chu tshags kyis zin par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag mig gis mthong bar gyur pa dang / gang dag chu tshags kyis zin par gyur pa'o //
translated: those that are seen by the eye and those that are caught by a strainer.

original: chus zhes bya ba ni chu nyid kyis so //🔽rtsva'am zhes bya ba ni rtsva nyid do //
analyzed: chus zhes bya ba ni chu nyid kyis so // rtsva'am zhes bya ba ni rtsva nyid do //
translated: “Water” means water itself.🔽“Grass” means grass itself.

original: lci ba'am zhes bya ba ni lci ba nyid do //
analyzed: lci ba'am zhes bya ba ni lci ba nyid do //
translated: “Mud” means mud itself.

original: sa la zhes bya ba yang sa nyid la'o //
analyzed: sa la zhes bya ba yang sa nyid la'o //
translated: “On the ground” means on the ground itself.

original: 'debs sam zhes bya ba ni rang gis @138a * //
analyzed: 'debs sam zhes bya ba ni rang gis @138a * //
translated: “Pours” means by oneself.

original: so ; /'debs su 'jud na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: so ; /'debs su 'jud na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “Causes to be planted” means by another.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense of wrong conduct” is as explained above.

original: 'dir srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed dang / 'og nas srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed ces 'byung ba de gnyis spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dir srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed dang / 'og nas srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa'i ltung byed ces 'byung ba de gnyis spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dra'o //
translated: Here, the offense of using water containing living beings and the offense of using water containing living beings below are similar in their general characteristics.

original: bye brag tu 'di ni rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang / 'jug tu 'jug pa de gnyis kyi yul la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: bye brag tu 'di ni rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang / 'jug tu 'jug pa de gnyis kyi yul la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The difference is that this is determined in terms of the object of engaging in what is not one’s own use and causing another to engage in it.

original: 'og ma ni rang spyod pa'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang / 'jug tu 'jud pa de gnyis kyi yul la rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'og ma ni rang spyod pa'i don nyid la 'jug pa dang / 'jug tu 'jud pa de gnyis kyi yul la rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The one below is determined in terms of the object of engaging in one’s own use and causing another to engage in it.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here, the offense of the actual basis is as follows.

original: dge slong gis shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva 'am lci ba 'am /
analyzed: dge slong gis shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva 'am lci ba 'am /
translated: If a monk knowingly uses water containing living beings to water grass or clay,

original: sa la sogs pa rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i yul la 'debs sam /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i yul la 'debs sam /
translated: If one plants or causes to plant in a place that is not one’s own field, such as a field belonging to another,

original: 'debs su 'jud na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags re re shi ba'i mthar srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'debs su 'jud na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags re re shi ba'i mthar srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: then for each living being that dies in that place, one commits the actual basis of a downfall that is a natural offense, since it is a place that has living beings.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don du /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don du /
translated: The agent of this is one who is not the owner of the field.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The main factor is the perception that the water has living beings in it.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the actual basis of a downfall is fivefold:

original: rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don gang yang rung ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / spyod pa dang / srog chags ji snyed shi ba'o //
analyzed: rang spyod pa ma yin pa'i don gang yang rung ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa dang / der 'du shes pa dang / spyod pa dang / srog chags ji snyed shi ba'o //
translated: a place that is not one’s own field, any living being that is included in the animal birth-state, the perception that it is there, the action, and the number of living beings that die.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is incomplete, then one commits a minor offense, as is appropriate.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bcu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed de bcu dgu pa'o /
translated: Allowing living beings to be harmed is the nineteenth downfall.

original: // / gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The Prelude to the Downfall Pertaining to Monasteries

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in the grove of Koshina.🔽At that time, the Venerable Group-of-Six stayed in monasteries built by others, and they were criticized by the monks.

original: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa drug sde dag gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang na gnas shing 'phyas 'dogs pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smad pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa nga rgyal skyes nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshe dang ldan pa drug sde dag gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang na gnas shing 'phyas 'dogs pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smad pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa nga rgyal skyes nas /
translated: The Venerable Chunda became proud,

original: des koo sh'amb'i na bram ze phyug pa /🔽nor mang ba /
analyzed: des koo sh'amb'i na bram ze phyug pa / nor mang ba /
translated: and in Koshina he approached a wealthy brahmin🔽who had much wealth,

original: longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: longs spyod che ba /
translated: great resources,

original: yongs su bzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba /
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba /
translated: and extensive and vast possessions.

original: ser sna can mig phra ba /
analyzed: ser sna can mig phra ba /
translated: He was stingy and had narrow eyes,

original: bya rog la yang gtor ma mi ster ba /
analyzed: bya rog la yang gtor ma mi ster ba /
translated: and he did not even give scraps to the crows.

original: yo byad kun 'dzin pa zhig 'dug pa de dad pa bskyed nas rdzas las @138b byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun po dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / des gtsug lag khang brtsig par khas blangs te /
analyzed: yo byad kun 'dzin pa zhig 'dug pa de dad pa bskyed nas rdzas las @138b byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun po dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / des gtsug lag khang brtsig par khas blangs te /
translated: The brahmin agreed to build a temple.

original: k'ara sh'a pa na dag sbyar te smras pa /
analyzed: k'ara sh'a pa na dag sbyar te smras pa /
translated: He prepared some gold coins and said,

original: btsun pa bdag la k'ara sh'a pa na dag ni mchis na /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag la k'ara sh'a pa na dag ni mchis na /
translated: “Lord, I have gold coins,

original: bsod nams kyi grogs bgyid pa ma mchis so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi grogs bgyid pa ma mchis so //
translated: but I have no one to help me make merit.”

original: 'dun pas smras pa /
analyzed: 'dun pas smras pa /
translated: Saṅgharakṣita said,

original: kho bos khyod kyi bsod nams kyi grogs byas /
analyzed: kho bos khyod kyi bsod nams kyi grogs byas /
translated: “I will help you make merit.🔽In return, you must appoint me as the saṅgha’s steward.”

original: 'di ltar khyed kyis kho bo dge 'dun gyis lag gi glar bskor chug shig / bram ze de gtsug lag khang du song nas dge 'dun la gsol ba dang / de na dag dge 'dun gyi nang na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan byed pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyis kho bo dge 'dun gyis lag gi glar bskor chug shig / bram ze de gtsug lag khang du song nas dge 'dun la gsol ba dang / de na dag dge 'dun gyi nang na tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan byed pas /
translated: The brahmin went to the temple and asked the saṅgha to do this, and in the saṅgha was the elder of the saṅgha, the venerable Śāriputra.

original: 'dun pa la smras pa /
analyzed: 'dun pa la smras pa /
translated: He said to Saṅgharakṣita,🔽“

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa gang gi tshe kho bos rgyal byed kyi tshal rtsig tu bcug pa de'i tshe yang kho bo sus kyang lag gi glar ma bskos so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa gang gi tshe kho bos rgyal byed kyi tshal rtsig tu bcug pa de'i tshe yang kho bo sus kyang lag gi glar ma bskos so //
translated: “Venerable Saṅgharakṣita, when I had the Jetavana built, no one appointed me as their representative.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen pos gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba rtsig tu bcug pa de'i tshe na yang de sus kyang lag gi glar ma bskos so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa skul byed chen pos gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba rtsig tu bcug pa de'i tshe na yang de sus kyang lag gi glar ma bskos so //
translated: When the venerable Mahācunda had the Ārāḍa Bamboo Grove built, no one appointed him as their representative.🔽If you also want to build a temple, have it built without appointing anyone as your representative.”

original: khyed kyang gal te gtsug lag khang byed du 'jug par 'dod na ma bskos pa nyid du byed du chug shig / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pas bsams pa /
analyzed: khyed kyang gal te gtsug lag khang byed du 'jug par 'dod na ma bskos pa nyid du byed du chug shig / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pas bsams pa /
translated: Venerable Saṅgharakṣita thought,

original: lhung bzed nag po can dag bdag can mthong bar yang mi dga' na /
analyzed: lhung bzed nag po can dag bdag can mthong bar yang mi dga' na /
translated: “The monks with black bowls don’t like to see me,

original: lag gi glar bskos te dad par ga la 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: lag gi glar bskos te dad par ga la 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: so how could they appoint me as their representative and have faith in me?”

original: bram ze de'i gan du song ste /
analyzed: bram ze de'i gan du song ste /
translated: He went to the brahmin and said,🔽“Brahmin, I want to build a temple.

original: k'ara sh'a pan dag blangs nas so phag mkhan dang / phyva mkhan dang / shing mkhan dang / zhal zhal mkhan dang / ri mo mkhan dang / gla mi'i gnas su song ste /
analyzed: k'ara sh'a pan dag blangs nas so phag mkhan dang / phyva mkhan dang / shing mkhan dang / zhal zhal mkhan dang / ri mo mkhan dang / gla mi'i gnas su song ste /
translated: He took some kārṣāpaṇas and went to the potter, the carpenter, the woodworker, the plasterer, the painter, and the laborers.

original: k'ara sh'a pa na dag byin nas de'i nyi ma gcig kho nas gtsug lag khang chen po sum rtseg sgo'i sbubs kyi gnas dang / gtan pa'i gnas dang ; skar khung dang / chu khung gi gnas dag kyang ma bzhag par de bzhin kho nar spyad 'dra bar brtsigs te /
analyzed: k'ara sh'a pa na dag byin nas de'i nyi ma gcig kho nas gtsug lag khang chen po sum rtseg sgo'i sbubs kyi gnas dang / gtan pa'i gnas dang ; skar khung dang / chu khung gi gnas dag kyang ma bzhag par de bzhin kho nar spyad 'dra bar brtsigs te /
translated: He gave them the kārṣāpaṇas and in just one day they built a great temple with three stories, with a courtyard, with a place for the door, with windows, and with a place for the water spouts, just like the one that had been destroyed.

original: de bram ze'i gan du song nas smras pa /
analyzed: de bram ze'i gan du song nas smras pa /
translated: He went to the brahmin and said,

original: bram ze khyod kyi gtsug lag khang zin gyis tshur shog / dge 'dun la phul cig / bram zes smras pa /
analyzed: bram ze khyod kyi gtsug lag khang zin gyis tshur shog / dge 'dun la phul cig / bram zes smras pa /
translated: “Brahmin, your temple is finished. Come and offer it to the saṅgha.” The brahmin said,

original: 'phags pa deng bdag gis zhal zas sta go nam bgyis kyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa deng bdag gis zhal zas sta go nam bgyis kyis /
translated: “Noble one, I have not prepared any food today.

original: sang bdag gis zhal zas sta gon bgyis te mchi'o //
analyzed: sang bdag gis zhal zas sta gon bgyis te mchi'o //
translated: I will come tomorrow after I have prepared some food.”🔽The Blessed One thought,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The Blessed One thought,🔽

original: gtsug lag chang 'di deng nyid du rdib par gyur te /
analyzed: gtsug lag chang 'di deng nyid du rdib par gyur te /
translated: If this monastery were to collapse today,

original: gal te yongs su ma spyad pa kho nar rdib par gyur na bram ze 'di khrag tsha ba skyugs te dus byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta @139a * //
analyzed: gal te yongs su ma spyad pa kho nar rdib par gyur na bram ze 'di khrag tsha ba skyugs te dus byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta @139a * //
translated: and if it were to collapse without being used, this brahmin would vomit hot blood and die.

original: bu'i gnas yod par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: bu'i gnas yod par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: Such a thing would happen.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas pa thob pa dag mtshan mo'i thun dang po la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas pa thob pa dag mtshan mo'i thun dang po la /
translated: Then the Blessed One placed the monks who had attained the state of meditative equipoise in the first watch of the night

original: gtsug lag khang der bzhag nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang der bzhag nas /
translated: in that monastery,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pas kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pas kyang /
translated: and the Blessed One himself, together with the retinue of gods such as Śakra and Brahmā,

original: mtshan mo'i gung thun la der chos bstan pa mdzad nas slar gshegs so //
analyzed: mtshan mo'i gung thun la der chos bstan pa mdzad nas slar gshegs so //
translated: taught the Dharma there during the middle watch of the night and then departed.

original: mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus nas nges gtsug lag khang de /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la sprin kha dog lnga pa 'dus nas nges gtsug lag khang de /
translated: In the last watch of the night, a five-colored cloud gathered and filled that monastery

original: dper na spyad chus gang bar bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na spyad chus gang bar bzhin du /
translated: as if it were filled with water.

original: chus gang bar gyur nas rdib par gyur to //
analyzed: chus gang bar gyur nas rdib par gyur to //
translated: It was filled with water and collapsed.

original: drug sde dag gis de thos nas skrag ste bros so //
analyzed: drug sde dag gis de thos nas skrag ste bros so //
translated: When the group of six heard this, they were frightened and ran away.

original: bram ze des kyang phyi de nyin par bca' ba dang bca' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas shing rta bkang ste 'ongs nas rang gi gtsug lag khang rdib pa mthong nas nga rgyal te sa la 'gyel to //
analyzed: bram ze des kyang phyi de nyin par bca' ba dang bca' ba gtsang zhing bsod pas shing rta bkang ste 'ongs nas rang gi gtsug lag khang rdib pa mthong nas nga rgyal te sa la 'gyel to //
translated: The next day, the brahmin filled a cart with food and pure, fine food and came. Seeing his temple collapse, he became arrogant and fell to the ground.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo las /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo las /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: bram ze la bka' stsal te /
analyzed: bram ze la bka' stsal te /
translated: Speak to the brahmin.

original: lha dang mi mang po dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa la bsngos te /
analyzed: lha dang mi mang po dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa la bsngos te /
translated: Many gods and humans have dedicated this to the Tathāgata,

original: gtsug lag khang dag byed du bcug pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su longs ma spyad kyi /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dag byed du bcug pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su longs ma spyad kyi /
translated: and the Tathāgata has not fully enjoyed those temples that have been built.

original: khyod kyi gtsug lag khang gang yin pa 'di ni mdang mtshan mo'i thun dang po la /
analyzed: khyod kyi gtsug lag khang gang yin pa 'di ni mdang mtshan mo'i thun dang po la /
translated: But this temple of yours, during the first watch of the night,🔽will be filled with water and collapse.

original: dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis yongs su longs phyod cing mtshan mo'i gung thun la yang bcom ldan 'das brgya byin dang tshang pa dang bcas pa lha rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pas yongs su longs spyad pas khyod kyis ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed do
analyzed: dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gis yongs su longs phyod cing mtshan mo'i gung thun la yang bcom ldan 'das brgya byin dang tshang pa dang bcas pa lha rnams kyi 'khor dang bcas pas yongs su longs spyad pas khyod kyis ni rnyed pa legs par rnyed do
translated: The Blessed One, Śakra, Brahmā, and the rest of the gods have enjoyed this monastery during the first and last watches of the night.”🔽The brahmin said, “Venerable Ānanda, if that is so, I am happy to have you build such a monastery for me every day.”

original: zhes bsgo'o // de nas bram ze de btsun pa kun dga' bo gal te de lta na bdag gdugs re re zhing gtsug lag khang 'di lta bu sha stag bgyid du stsol bar yang spro'o zhes zer ba drug sde dag gis thos nas der lhags pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bsgo'o // de nas bram ze de btsun pa kun dga' bo gal te de lta na bdag gdugs re re zhing gtsug lag khang 'di lta bu sha stag bgyid du stsol bar yang spro'o zhes zer ba drug sde dag gis thos nas der lhags pa dang /
translated: The group of six heard this and came to the brahmin.

original: bram ze des de dag la ras yug chen sar pa re re bskon cing /
analyzed: bram ze des de dag la ras yug chen sar pa re re bskon cing /
translated: The brahmin gave each of them a new length of cloth and🔽provided them with all the requisites.

original: yo byad thams cad kyis kyang bstabs pa dang / drug sde dag kho bo cag gis de ltar bram ze de'i nor de snyed chud gsan du zin kyang /
analyzed: yo byad thams cad kyis kyang bstabs pa dang / drug sde dag kho bo cag gis de ltar bram ze de'i nor de snyed chud gsan du zin kyang /
translated: The group of six said, “We have wasted so much of the brahmin’s wealth,

original: 'on kyang des kho bo cag la ras yug chen sar pa re re bskon cing yo byad thams cad kyis kyang bstabs par gyur pa de ltar kho bo cag gis bram ze de mngon par dad par byas so zhes rlom par byed @139b nas ;
analyzed: 'on kyang des kho bo cag la ras yug chen sar pa re re bskon cing yo byad thams cad kyis kyang bstabs par gyur pa de ltar kho bo cag gis bram ze de mngon par dad par byas so zhes rlom par byed @139b nas ;
translated: But they boast, “We have made that brahmin have faith in us by giving him a new, large piece of cloth and all the provisions.”

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir /🔽dge slong dag yan lag gang gis ngo tsha bar bya ba'i yan lag de nyid kyis rlom par byed ces smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /🔽kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir / dge slong dag yan lag gang gis ngo tsha bar bya ba'i yan lag de nyid kyis rlom par byed ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed / kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: “Why do the monks who have few desires🔽boast with the very limbs with which they should be ashamed?”

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: They criticized, disparaged, and complained and the monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: Then the Blessed One, as in the previous story,

original: de dge slong gis gtsug lag khang chen po rtsig tu 'jug na sgo'i sbubs dang / gtan pa dang / snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes kyis sa brtag pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de dge slong gis gtsug lag khang chen po rtsig tu 'jug na sgo'i sbubs dang / gtan pa dang / snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes kyis sa brtag pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “If a monk is building a large temple, he may dig the ground up to the extent of the door frame, the threshold, and the light well.

original: pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gnyis sam gsum brtsig par bya'o //
analyzed: pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gnyis sam gsum brtsig par bya'o //
translated: He should build two or three layers of stone with mortar.

original: de las lhag par brtsigs na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de las lhag par brtsigs na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: If he builds more than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: yul ni koo sh'amb'i /
analyzed: yul ni koo sh'amb'i /
translated: The place was Kauśāmbī.

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /
translated: The person was the group of six monks.

original: nyon mongs pa ni las ngan pa la dga' ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni las ngan pa la dga' ba /
translated: The affliction was delighting in bad actions.

original: nyes pa ni gtsug lag khang pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gnyis sam gsum las lhag par brtsigs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gtsug lag khang pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gnyis sam gsum las lhag par brtsigs pa'o //
translated: The offense was building a temple with more than two or three layers of stone with mortar.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: As for “a monk,” it refers to the group of six monks or anyone similar to them.

original: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byar rung ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag byar rung ba'o //
translated: As for “temple,” it is a place where the four modes of behavior—walking, standing, sitting, and lying down—are possible.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po gnyis te /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po gnyis te /
translated: As for “large,” there are two kinds of large:

original: sbyin par bya ba las dang / tshad las te /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba las dang / tshad las te /
translated: large in terms of the materials used and large in terms of the measurements.

original: don 'dir ni gnyi ga yin par dgongs so //
analyzed: don 'dir ni gnyi ga yin par dgongs so //
translated: In this case, it is intended to mean both.

original: rtsig tu 'jud na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan no //
analyzed: rtsig tu 'jud na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan no //
translated: “If he builds” means if he builds it himself or has another build it.

original: sgo'i sbubs dang gtan pa zhes bya ba ni sgo'i sbubs dang gtan pa gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo'i sbubs dang gtan pa zhes bya ba ni sgo'i sbubs dang gtan pa gzhug par bya'o //
translated: “The door frame and the door fittings” means the door frame and the door fittings should be installed.

original: snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes pas zhes bya ba ni skar khung dag dang / chu khung gi gnas ji tsam gtod par bya ba'i 'du shes kyis so //
analyzed: snang ba'i gnas ji tsam pa'i 'du shes pas zhes bya ba ni skar khung dag dang / chu khung gi gnas ji tsam gtod par bya ba'i 'du shes kyis so //
translated: “With the perception of the size of the opening for the window or the opening for the ventilation shaft” means with the perception of the size of the opening for the window or the opening for the ventilation shaft.

original: sa brtag pa nas bzung ste pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gnyis sam gsum zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa brtag pa nas bzung ste pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gnyis sam gsum zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Starting from the foundation” means two or three layers of bricks with mud.

original: pha gu'i rim pa zhes bya ba ni pha gu rtseg ma'o //
analyzed: pha gu'i rim pa zhes bya ba ni pha gu rtseg ma'o //
translated: “Layers of bricks” means a stack of bricks.

original: 'jim pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni sa 'jim pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jim pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni sa 'jim pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: “With mud” means with mud on the ground.

original: brtsig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtsig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: “He should build” means he should place.

original: de las lhag par brtsigs na zhes bya ba ni de las lhag par 'jog na'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par brtsigs na zhes bya ba ni de las lhag par 'jog na'o //
translated: “If he builds more than that” means if he places more than that.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “One commits an offense entailing confession” is as above.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽dge slong gis gtsug lag khang spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad thams cad rdo'am /🔽so phag gam /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni / dge slong gis gtsug lag khang spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad thams cad rdo'am / so phag gam /
translated: The following is a presentation of the actual downfalls.

original: shing @140a * //
analyzed: shing @140a * //
translated: A monk may build a temple, provided it is large enough to accommodate four persons sitting in the seven-point posture, and is not made of stone, brick, or wood.

original: las byas pa ma yin pa char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa /🔽dge 'dun gyi'am /
analyzed: las byas pa ma yin pa char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa / dge 'dun gyi'am /
translated: It should not be covered with a roof that can be damaged by rain.

original: gang zag gi'am /
analyzed: gang zag gi'am /
translated: It may be built for the community or for an individual.

original: khyim pa dbang ba yang rung ba yon bdag gis byas sam zin nas blta'o zhes smras pa chu khung dag ma btod pa'am /
analyzed: khyim pa dbang ba yang rung ba yon bdag gis byas sam zin nas blta'o zhes smras pa chu khung dag ma btod pa'am /
translated: If the owner is a layperson, the monk should check whether the temple has been built or is being built on land that belongs to the layperson.

original: brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba ma brtsigs pa'am /
analyzed: brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba ma brtsigs pa'am /
translated: The monk should also check whether the temple has been dug into the ground or whether the foundation has been laid.

original: sgo cha gong ma ma bcug pa yang rung ba la /🔽rang ngam gzhan gyis nyi ma de nyid la pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gsum las lhag par rtsig gam /
analyzed: sgo cha gong ma ma bcug pa yang rung ba la / rang ngam gzhan gyis nyi ma de nyid la pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gsum las lhag par rtsig gam /
translated: He should also check whether the upper part of the door has been put in place.🔽If the monk or another person builds a wall of more than three layers of bricks and mud on that very day,

original: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pa med par rim pa gsum las lhag par brtsigs na /
analyzed: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pa med par rim pa gsum las lhag par brtsigs na /
translated: or if the wall is built of more than three layers of bricks without mud on another day,

original: gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a basis of defeat for a monk to do this.🔽The agent of this is a monk.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni gtsug lag khang spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad rdo'am /🔽so phag gam /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni gtsug lag khang spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad rdo'am / so phag gam /
translated: The object is a temple that can accommodate four postures and is not made of stone, brick, or wood.

original: shing las byas pa ma yin pa char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa /
analyzed: shing las byas pa ma yin pa char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa /
translated: It is not covered to protect against rain.

original: dge 'dun gyi 'am /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi 'am /
translated: It is the property of the saṅgha,

original: gang zag gi'am /
analyzed: gang zag gi'am /
translated: an individual,

original: khyim pa dbang ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dbang ba'o //
translated: or a householder.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basis of defeat is completed by five limbs:

original: gtsug lag khang spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad rdo 'am so phag gam shing las byas pa ma yin pa char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa dge 'dun gyi'am gang zag gi'am /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad rdo 'am so phag gam shing las byas pa ma yin pa char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa ma byas pa dge 'dun gyi'am gang zag gi'am /
translated: The temple can accommodate four postures and is not made of stone, brick, or wood. It is not covered to protect against rain. It is the property of the saṅgha, an individual,🔽or a householder.

original: khyim pa yang rung ba dang / yon bdag gis byas nas blta'o zhe'am /
analyzed: khyim pa yang rung ba dang / yon bdag gis byas nas blta'o zhe'am /
translated: The benefactor has built it and says, “I will look at it,”🔽or “I will look at it when it is finished.”

original: zin nas blta'o zhes dge slong rnams la smras pa dang / chu khung dag ma btod pa 'am /
analyzed: zin nas blta'o zhes dge slong rnams la smras pa dang / chu khung dag ma btod pa 'am /
translated: The monk says, “I will look at it when the water channels are dug,”

original: brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba ma btsugs pa'am /
analyzed: brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba ma btsugs pa'am /
translated: or “I will look at it when the foundation is dug,”🔽or “I will look at it when the foundation is laid.”

original: sgo cha gong ma ma bcug pa yang rung ba dang / rang ngam gzhan gang yang rung bas rtsig pa dang / nyi ma de nyid la pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gsum las lhag par rtsig gam /
analyzed: sgo cha gong ma ma bcug pa yang rung ba dang / rang ngam gzhan gang yang rung bas rtsig pa dang / nyi ma de nyid la pha gu'i rim pa 'jim pa dang bcas pa gsum las lhag par rtsig gam /
translated: It is also the same if the door is not more than four cubits high.

original: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pa med par rim pa gsum las lhag par brtsigs pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pa med par rim pa gsum las lhag par brtsigs pa'o //
translated: If one builds a wall or a wall of more than three layers of mud bricks on that very day, or if one builds a wall of more than three layers of mud bricks on another day without mud,

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: and if one of these is incomplete, one commits a serious transgression as appropriate.

original: gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed de nyid shu pa'o /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed de nyid shu pa'o /
translated: This is the downfall of building a temple.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo'i gzhung 'grel /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo'i gzhung 'grel /
translated: The commentary on the summary of the text of the Pratimoksha

original: bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu pa /
translated: The summary:🔽Not appointed, sunset, two, food, and Dharma robes,

original: sdom la / ma bskos nyi ma nub pa dang / zas dang chos gos gnyis dag dang / don mthun gru dang dben pa gnyis /
analyzed: sdom la / ma bskos nyi ma nub pa dang / zas dang chos gos gnyis dag dang / don mthun gru dang dben pa gnyis /
translated: Traveling together, boat, two, secluded,

original: dge slong ma yis sbyor bcug pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma yis sbyor bcug pa'o //
translated: and a nun acting as one’s assistant.

original: zhes bya ba ni bcu pa gsum pa dag yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bcu pa gsum pa dag yin te /
translated: These are the ten of the third chapter.

original: sdom la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang / dgos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don dang / dgos pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning of the words of the summary and the purpose are the same as before.

original: bcu pa gsum pa 'dis kyang ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /
analyzed: bcu pa gsum pa 'dis kyang ltung byed kyi chos bcu bstan te /
translated: also presents the ten downfalls that require relinquishment.

original: ma bskos par ston pa dang / nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa @140b dang ; zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa dang / gos byed pa dang / dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa dang / dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: ma bskos par ston pa dang / nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa @140b dang ; zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa dang / gos byed pa dang / dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'gron lam du 'jug pa dang / dge slong ma dang lhan cig grur 'jug pa dang /
translated: They are to teach without being appointed, to teach until sunset, to teach for the sake of mere material gain, to make robes, to set out on the road with fully ordained nuns, to board a boat with fully ordained nuns,

original: gcig pu 'dug pa dang / gcig pu 'greng pa dang / dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa za ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: gcig pu 'dug pa dang / gcig pu 'greng pa dang / dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa za ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: to sit alone with a fully ordained nun, to stand alone with a fully ordained nun, and to eat food that has been procured by a fully ordained nun.

original: de la ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: de la ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin of the downfall that requires relinquishment of teaching without being appointed

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Jetavana, Anathapindika’s Park near Shravasti.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gi res kyis dge slong ma la bstan par bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan dag gi res kyis dge slong ma la bstan par bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One had said, “The most senior monks should teach the nuns by turns.”

original: dge slong drug sde dag la dge slong ma la ston pa'i res bab pa na /🔽de dag ci tsam pa de tsam bstan nas de dag dang lhan cig tho 'tshams par byed /
analyzed: dge slong drug sde dag la dge slong ma la ston pa'i res bab pa na / de dag ci tsam pa de tsam bstan nas de dag dang lhan cig tho 'tshams par byed /
translated: The group of six monks taught the nuns.🔽They taught them as much as they wanted, and then they made fun of them.

original: kun tu rtse bar byed /🔽kun du ca co 'don par byed /
analyzed: kun tu rtse bar byed / kun du ca co 'don par byed /
translated: They played with them.🔽They made loud noises with them.

original: gzhogs stegs dang / 'phyar g-yeng dang / lus la reg pa dag byed do //
analyzed: gzhogs stegs dang / 'phyar g-yeng dang / lus la reg pa dag byed do //
translated: They made sidelong remarks, they made remarks with raised voices, and they touched their bodies.

original: de na gang dag bdag gir byed pa /
analyzed: de na gang dag bdag gir byed pa /
translated: Those who were jealous🔽made fun of them.🔽They played with them.

original: de dag ni de dag dang lhan cig tho 'tshams par byed /🔽kun du rtsa bar byed /🔽kun du ca co 'don par byed /
analyzed: de dag ni de dag dang lhan cig tho 'tshams par byed / kun du rtsa bar byed / kun du ca co 'don par byed /
translated: They made loud noises with them.

original: gzhogs stegs dang / 'phyar g-yeng dang / lus la rdeg pa dag byed do //
analyzed: gzhogs stegs dang / 'phyar g-yeng dang / lus la rdeg pa dag byed do //
translated: They made sidelong remarks, they made remarks with raised voices, and they hit their bodies.🔽Those who were not jealous said, “They stay in the open, in the forest, in the temple, in the courtyard, in the upper room, in the assembly hall, and in the gatehouse.

original: gang dag bdag gri mi byed pa de dag ni 'chags dang / dgar dang sgo khang dag na gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa 'di lta bu dag bdag cag la ston par byed do zhes smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: gang dag bdag gri mi byed pa de dag ni 'chags dang / dgar dang sgo khang dag na gnas ngan len kun du spyod pa 'di lta bu dag bdag cag la ston par byed do zhes smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They are acting in this degenerate way and teaching it to us.”🔽They criticized them,

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: they insulted them,🔽and they slandered them.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One about it, and the Blessed One said,

translated: “Except if she has qualities like these” means except for the venerable Upāli, who had qualities like these.🔽“Offense” means to burn, to scorch, to cause to fall, to cause to drop, to cause to fall into the lower realms, to cause to fall into the hells, to cause to fall into the animal realm, to cause to fall into the realm of hungry ghosts, to cause to fall into the bad rebirths, to cause to fall into the lower realms.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / ko tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos dag las gang yang rung ba'o /
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / ko tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos dag las gang yang rung ba'o /
translated: “Cloth” means any of the seven kinds of cloth: wool, silk, cotton, linen, coarse cloth, woolen felt, or jute.

analyzed: sbyin na zhes bya ba ni bsab mi dgos par ro //
translated: “If he gives it” means if he gives it without being asked.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Offense of wrong conduct” is as explained above.

analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here is the presentation of the basic offense:

analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la gos dbul ba ma gtogs par dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa /

translated: The actual basis of the downfall is to give a suitable robe to a non-relative nun who is not a relative, who is not a friend, who has not lost her belongings, who has not spoken well of the gift, who has not received full ordination, and who does not wish to exchange robes, if the nun perceives her as such and the robe covers all three areas.

analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //

analyzed: 'di la yan lag drug gis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: dge slong dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la gos dbul ba ma yin pa dang / dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa dang / de bor rlag byung ba 'am /

analyzed: legs par smra ba 'am /
translated: she has not spoken well of the gift,

analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa'am /
translated: she has not received full ordination,🔽and she does not wish to exchange robes.

analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //

analyzed: gos sbyin pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu bzhi pa'o /

original: // / gos byed pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / gos byed pa'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /

analyzed: bdag nyid sbed ma'i mgul nas 'khyud de 'dug pa zhig skud ris su btsems nas bltab ste sbed ma la sbyin nas /
translated: in the form of a hidden woman embracing him around the neck. He folded it and gave it to Siṃha.

analyzed: re zhig ji tsam du tshon gyis ma bcal ba de srid du ma dbye shig / ltung ba dang bcas par gyur ta re zhes smras so //
translated: “Do not open it until the dye is finished. Otherwise you will be at fault.”🔽Siṃha took the robe just as it was to the rainy season retreat house.

analyzed: sbed mas snam sbyar de de bzhin kho nar dbyar khang du 'phags pa dang / dge slong ma grogs mo dag gis /

analyzed: 'phags pa 'char kas snam sbyar ji ltar btsems pa bltas /

analyzed: de dag gis snam sbyar hur ces phrogs nas phye ste bltas pa dang / de la tshon sna lnga'i skud pas 'char ka sbed ma'i ma gul nas 'khyud de 'dug pa skud ris su btsems pa mthong nas /

analyzed: de dag gis rta gad kyis btab ste /

analyzed: smras pa / sbed ma khyod la 'phag pa 'char kas yun ring mo zhig gis gzod 'khyud do //

original: de skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta m'is thos nas /
analyzed: de skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo goo ta m'is thos nas /

analyzed: nu mo dag drug sde gnas ngan len kun tu spyod pa dag gis 'drums pa ltung bas /
translated: “Sisters, the group of six are acting improperly.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa 'jig par byed do zhes zer ba'i skabs de /

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
translated: The nuns told the monks,

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: and the monks told the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'char ka la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'char ka la /
translated: The Blessed One said to Udāyī,🔽“Udāyī, is it true that you did this?”

original: khyed dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa'i gos byed pa bden nam zhes rmas nas snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: khyed dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa'i gos byed pa bden nam zhes rmas nas snga ma bzhin du /
translated: “Is it true, as they say, that you, a fully ordained monk, made robes for a fully ordained nun who is not a relative?”

analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa'i gos byed na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: “If a fully ordained monk makes robes for a fully ordained nun who is not a relative, he commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The location for this rule is in Śrāvastī.🔽The individual is the monk Udayi.

original: gang zag ni 'char ka / nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags /
analyzed: gang zag ni 'char ka / nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags /
translated: The affliction is any of the three poisons.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa'i gos byed pa'o //🔽de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka'am /
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa'i gos byed pa'o // de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka'am /

analyzed: de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //

analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /

analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyang aa mra'i khur ba dag gsol cig / des smras pa kho bo stan gcig pa yin no //

analyzed: khyim bdag bdag 'ba' zhig gis aa mra'i khur ba dag zos par ma zad kyi /

analyzed: drug sde 'di dag gis kyang aa mra'i khur ba dag zos so //

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,🔽“Noble ones, I will give you as much as you want of whatever you need.

analyzed: 'phags pa ci'i phyir de skad zer zhes spyos te smras pa /

analyzed: skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
translated: told the Blessed One in detail about the situation, and the Blessed One, as before,

analyzed: yang yang za na dus ma gtogs te ltung byed do //

analyzed: lam dus so // gos sbyin pa'i tshe dus te /

original: yul ni spong byed /
analyzed: yul ni spong byed /

analyzed: nyes pa ni yang yang za ba'o //

analyzed: dus ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dus bzhag ste'o //
translated: “Except in the case of a special occasion” means except in the case of a special occasion that has been set aside.

analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni /

original: de la dus ni 'di yin te /

translated: ‘When you are traveling’ means that

analyzed: dge slong dpag tshad phyed du song ngam / de'i phyed du song @153a * //
translated: a monk who has gone a half-league or

analyzed: phyis kyang rung ste /

analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this is

analyzed: gos kyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa nyid do //

analyzed: las byas pa'am /

analyzed: gos gyi rin gyi rnyed pa med pa nyid dang de zos pa'o //
translated: The later invitation is without the acquisition of cloth or the price of cloth.

analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these are missing, it is a minor infraction.

analyzed: yang yang za ba'i ltung byed de sum cu gcig pa'o /

original: // / 'dug gnas su za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / 'dug gnas su za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The downfall of eating in a monastery

analyzed: ri brags shig na khyim bdag gcig 'dug pa des /

analyzed: phyogs bzhi'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyi don du 'dug gnas byad du bcug ste /

analyzed: de 'dug gnas de na phyogs bzhi'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze gang 'dug pa de la bsod snyoms kyi mkho ba stobs par byed do //

analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis mnyan yod du cho 'phrul chen po rnam par bstan te /

analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can dag tshar gcad cing /

translated: At that time, the non-Buddhists were living in the border regions.

analyzed: khyim bdag des da dag la mkho ba stobs par byed pa /

analyzed: tshong pa des 'di dag bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos dag yin gor ma chag gis song la blta snyam nas der song ba dang / ji tsam na gcer bu pa ngo tsha dang khrel bor ba sha stag yin par mthong ngo //
translated: The merchant thought, These must be disciples of the Blessed One. I will go and see. He went there and saw only naked ascetics who had abandoned shame and modesty.

analyzed: su la brtsi na 'bras @157a * //

analyzed: de'i chan ni sum 'gyur te bre phyed dang lnga yod do //

analyzed: 'bras chan ni bre phyed dang lnga yod de /

analyzed: 'bras chan bre phyed dang lnga de'i rkyen gyi bya na dang / tshod ma dang bcas pa man chad blugs par bya'i /

original: de las lhag na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las lhag na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //

original: phye dang khur ba la sogs pa bza' ba dang / bca' ba'i bsod snyoms gzhan dag la yang bdag dgag pa'i tshad ni /
analyzed: phye dang khur ba la sogs pa bza' ba dang / bca' ba'i bsod snyoms gzhan dag la yang bdag dgag pa'i tshad ni /

analyzed: chung tshad ni 'grangs pa tsam shong ba yin no // de la lhag par len na zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed 'bring gsum gyi tshad 'bras chan bre phyed dang lnga /
translated: The small begging bowl is the size that can hold one full bre.🔽If one takes more than that, means if one takes more than a half-bre of boiled rice, and the measure of boiled rice, and vegetables that go with it.

analyzed: de'i rkyen gyi bya na dang / tshod ma dang bcas pa de las lhag par len na'o //
translated: If one takes more than that, means if one takes more than the measure of boiled rice, and the measure of boiled rice, and vegetables that go with it.🔽If one takes more than that, means if one takes more than the measure of boiled rice, and the measure of boiled rice, and vegetables that go with it.

analyzed: dge slong dag nga ni stan gcig pa'i zas za ste /

original: bstan gcig pa'i zas za ba na snying las chung ngur tshor zhing gnod pa nyung ba dang / nyam nga ba chung ba dang / bskyod ba yang ba dang / 'tsho ba dang stobs dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
analyzed: bstan gcig pa'i zas za ba na snying las chung ngur tshor zhing gnod pa nyung ba dang / nyam nga ba chung ba dang / bskyod ba yang ba dang / 'tsho ba dang stobs dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
translated: When you eat the food of one sitting, you will feel less distress and have fewer problems, less anxiety, and be more mobile, healthy, strong, and happy, and you will not be overcome by unwholesome states.

original: bde ba la reg par gnas par tshor ro //
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas par tshor ro //
translated: You will feel that you are living comfortably and happily.

original: dge slong dag khyed kyang tshur sheg la stan gcig pa'i zas zo shig dang / khyed kyang stan gcig pa'i zas za ba @158a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyang tshur sheg la stan gcig pa'i zas zo shig dang / khyed kyang stan gcig pa'i zas za ba @158a * //
translated: “Monks, you should also eat the food of one sitting,🔽for when you eat the food of one sitting, you will feel less distress and have fewer problems, less anxiety, and be more mobile, healthy, strong, and happy, and you will not be overcome by unwholesome states.

original: na ; snying las chung ngur tshor zhing gnod pa nyung ba dang / nyam nga ba chung ba dang / bskyod pa yang ba dang / 'tsho ba dang stobs dang ldan pa dang / bde ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par tshor bar 'gyur ro //

translated: You will feel that you are living comfortably and happily.

original: zas ma spangs pas ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya zhing /
analyzed: zas ma spangs pas ji tsam gyis chog pa bza' bar bya zhing /
translated: “You should eat as much as you need without rejecting any food.

original: zas brtsams pas slob dpon dang / mkhan po dang / bla ma dang / bla ma lta bu mthong na yang dang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zas brtsams pas slob dpon dang / mkhan po dang / bla ma dang / bla ma lta bu mthong na yang dang bar mi bya'o //
translated: If you see a teacher, preceptor, guru, or guru-like person while you are eating, you should not greet them.

original: bca' ba lnga po rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag gis ni spangs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bca' ba lnga po rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag gis ni spangs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: You do not break the training rules by eating the five foods that grow in the ground, or the five foods that grow in water, or the five foods that grow in trees, or the five foods that grow in villages, or the five foods that grow in the wilderness.

original: bza' ba lnga po 'bras chan dang zan dron dang / sha dang / snum khur dang / 'de gu dag gis ni spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bza' ba lnga po 'bras chan dang zan dron dang / sha dang / snum khur dang / 'de gu dag gis ni spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: You do break the training rules by eating the five cooked foods: cooked grain, cooked vegetables, meat, soup, and pastries.

original: rgyu lnga po zas yod pa dang / zas stobs pa yod pa dang / zas brtsams pa yod pa dang / zas spangs pa yod pa dang / spyod lam las nyams pa dag gis ni spangs pa brjod par bya la ;🔽rgyu lnga po zas med pa dang / zas stobs pa med pa dang / zas brtsams pa med pa /
analyzed: rgyu lnga po zas yod pa dang / zas stobs pa yod pa dang / zas brtsams pa yod pa dang / zas spangs pa yod pa dang / spyod lam las nyams pa dag gis ni spangs pa brjod par bya la ; rgyu lnga po zas med pa dang / zas stobs pa med pa dang / zas brtsams pa med pa /
translated: You should announce that you have broken the training rules if you have eaten any of the five foods that are the basis for breaking the training rules: food that you have asked for, food that you have had someone else ask for, food that you have had someone bring to you, food that you have had someone bring to you after asking for it, or food that you have had someone bring to you after asking someone else to do so.

original: zas spangs pa med pa dang / spyod lam las ma nyams pa dag gis ni /🔽ma spangs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zas spangs pa med pa dang / spyod lam las ma nyams pa dag gis ni /🔽ma spangs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: You should announce that you have not broken the training rules if you have not eaten any of the five foods that are the basis for breaking the training rules: food that you have not asked for, food that you have not had someone ask for, food that you have not had someone bring to you, food that you have not had someone bring to you after asking for it, or food that you have not had someone bring to you after asking someone else to do so.🔽You should announce that you have not broken the training rules if you have not done any of the five things that are the basis for breaking the training rules: you have not eaten food that you have asked for, you have not eaten food that you have had someone ask for, you have not eaten food that you have had someone bring to you, you have not eaten food that you have had someone bring to you after asking for it, or you have not eaten food that you have had someone bring to you after asking someone else to do so.

original: gzhan yang tshig lhag ma med pa lnga po thong shig ces bya ba dang gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / song shig ces bya ba dang / zos zin to zhes bya ba dang / chog go zhes bya ba dag gis ni spangs par brjod par bya la /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshig lhag ma med pa lnga po thong shig ces bya ba dang gzhan la byin cig ces bya ba dang / song shig ces bya ba dang / zos zin to zhes bya ba dang / chog go zhes bya ba dag gis ni spangs par brjod par bya la /
translated: The five without remainder are: “Give up,” “Give to another,” “Go,” “I have eaten,” and “I have had enough.”

original: tshig lhag ma dang bcas pa lnga po re zhig thong shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig gzhan la sbyin cig ces bya ba dang / re zhig song shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig zos zin to zhes bya ba dang / re zhig chog go zhes bya ba dag gis ni ma spangs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma dang bcas pa lnga po re zhig thong shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig gzhan la sbyin cig ces bya ba dang / re zhig song shig ces bya ba dang / re zhig zos zin to zhes bya ba dang / re zhig chog go zhes bya ba dag gis ni ma spangs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The five with remainder are: “Give up for now,” “Give to another for now,” “Go for now,” “I have eaten for now,” and “I have had enough for now.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis spangs pas bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis spangs pas bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks should not eat what has been given up.”

original: drug sde dag spangs pas kyang za bar byed /
analyzed: drug sde dag spangs pas kyang za bar byed /
translated: The group of six ate what had been given up.

original: ma spangs pas kyang za bar byed nas /
analyzed: ma spangs pas kyang za bar byed nas /
translated: They also ate what had not been given up.

original: dge slong don nyung du dag / bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis spangs pas za bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag / bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gis spangs pas za bar mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: “Monks, the Blessed One has said, ‘A monk should not eat what he has rejected.’🔽Why do monks eat what they have rejected?

original: ci'i phyir dge slong spangs pas kyang bza' bar byed /🔽ma spangs pas kyang za bar byed ces smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge slong spangs pas kyang bza' bar byed / ma spangs pas kyang za bar byed ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: Why do they eat what they have not rejected?”

original: kha zer ba byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: kha zer ba byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: They criticized, disparaged, and complained and said this to one another.

original: dge slong rnams @158b kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams @158b kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /🔽yang dge slong gang zas zos zin cing spangs pa las lhag bor ma byas par bca' ba'am /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du / yang dge slong gang zas zos zin cing spangs pa las lhag bor ma byas par bca' ba'am /
translated: Then the Blessed One, as was appropriate, instructed, exhorted, inspired, and delighted the monks with a discourse on the Dharma.🔽He then laid down a rule for the monks that a monk who has eaten and rejected food should not eat what he has not had left for him.

original: bza' ba 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad do //
analyzed: bza' ba 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad do //
translated: If he does, he commits an offense.

original: yul ni mnyan yod na /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod na /

translated: The Blessed One said, Monks, you should not give food to a monk who has finished eating and is not taking leftovers. If you do, you have committed a pāyattika offense.

original: yul ni mnyan yod /
analyzed: yul ni mnyan yod /
translated: The place was Śrāvastī.

original: gang zag ni dge slong rgan zhugs /
analyzed: gang zag ni dge slong rgan zhugs /
translated: The person was an elder monk.

original: nyon mongs pa ni nyes rtsom /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni nyes rtsom /
translated: The affliction was a fault.

original: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa la lhag por ma byas pa'i bza' ba dang ltung ba dus kyis stobs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni shes bzhin du dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa la lhag por ma byas pa'i bza' ba dang ltung ba dus kyis stobs pa'o //
translated: The fault was that, knowingly, a monk gave food to a monk who had finished eating and was not taking leftovers.

original: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //🔽shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyis rig pa'am /
analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o // shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de rang nyid kyis rig pa'am /
translated: In this case, monk means a monk of this doctrine.

original: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so //
translated: Knowingly means that he himself knows or that others tell him.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: Monk means a monk of this doctrine.

original: zas zos zin cing spangs pa la zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa la'o //
analyzed: zas zos zin cing spangs pa la zhes bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs shing mthar thug par byas pa la'o //
translated: Who has finished eating and is not taking leftovers means that he has completely finished eating.

original: skabs tshol zhing zhes bya ba ni klan ka tshol zhing ngo //
analyzed: skabs tshol zhing zhes bya ba ni klan ka tshol zhing ngo //
translated: “Looking for an opportunity” means looking for a chance.🔽“Thinking, ‘How can I make this monk commit an offense?’” means thinking, “How can I make this monk commit an offense and be expelled?”

original: ci nas kyang dge slong 'di nyes pa 'byung bar bya'o snyam pa zhes bya ba ni ji nas kyang dge slong 'di lung ba dang bcas par byas par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o de nyid rkyen du byas nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ci nas kyang dge slong 'di nyes pa 'byung bar bya'o snyam pa zhes bya ba ni ji nas kyang dge slong 'di lung ba dang bcas par byas par 'gyur ro snyam pa'o de nyid rkyen du byas nas zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Making that the basis” means not anything else.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di 'cho zhig /'di zo shig ces bya ba ni bca' ba dang bza' ba'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di 'cho zhig /'di zo shig ces bya ba ni bca' ba dang bza' ba'o //
translated: “Eat this, eat that” refers to solid and non-solid foods.

original: lhag por ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mar ma byas shing ma bor yongs su ma btang ba'i'o //
analyzed: lhag por ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni lhag mar ma byas shing ma bor yongs su ma btang ba'i'o //
translated: “Without having made it extra” means without having made it extra, without having discarded it, without having given it away.

original: bca' ba dang bca' ba zhes bya ba @160b ni bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga po dag go //
analyzed: bca' ba dang bca' ba zhes bya ba @160b ni bca' ba lnga po dang bza' ba lnga po dag go //
translated: “Solid and non-solid foods” refers to the five types of solid foods and the five types of non-solid foods.

original: dus kyis stobs na zhes bya ba ni yang yang du stobs na'o //
analyzed: dus kyis stobs na zhes bya ba ni yang yang du stobs na'o //
translated: “If he serves it again and again” means if he serves it repeatedly.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “One commits an offense entailing confession” is as explained above.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here is how the basic situation for the offense is presented:

original: dge slong gis shes bzhin du dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa la lhag por ma byas pa'i zas rung ba dus kyis stobs na /
analyzed: dge slong gis shes bzhin du dge slong zas zos zin cing spangs pa la lhag por ma byas pa'i zas rung ba dus kyis stobs na /
translated: A monk who, knowing that a monk has finished his meal and has refused leftover food, gives him suitable food that is not leftover, saying, “Eat this,”

original: spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: commits an offense entailing confession when the other monk has accepted the food.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent in this case

original: zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag por ma byas pa nyid dag las 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag por ma byas pa nyid dag las 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: is someone who has refused food and has not made it leftover.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basis is fivefold:

original: dge slong zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag por ma byas pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / dus su rung ba'i zas dang bstabs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zas spangs pa nyid dang / lhag por ma byas pa nyid dang / der 'du shes pa dang / dus su rung ba'i zas dang bstabs pa'o //
translated: a monk who has refused food and has not made it leftover, the perception of that, suitable food that is not leftover, giving it to him, and his acceptance of it.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is absent, then the offense is a minor one.

original: spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed de sum cu lnga pa'o /
analyzed: spangs pa la stobs pa'i ltung byed de sum cu lnga pa'o /
translated: This was the thirty-fifth training rule on giving food to a monk who has finished his meal.

original: // /'dus shing za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // /'dus shing za ba'i ltung byed kyi gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin of the training rule on eating in a group🔽At that time the Buddha was staying at the Squirrels’ Feeding Ground in Śrāvastī,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan dka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan dka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Rājagṛha, in the Kalandakanivāpa in the Veṇuvana.

original: de'i tshe na lhas byin dge slong rab tu mang po dag dang / lhan cig kun dga' ra ba'i nang du 'dus shing zas za nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na lhas byin dge slong rab tu mang po dag dang / lhan cig kun dga' ra ba'i nang du 'dus shing zas za nas /
translated: At that time, Devadatta was eating in the monastery together with many monks.

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir /
translated: “Why are the monks eating in the monastery together?

original: dge slong dag kun dga' ra ba'i nang na 'dus shing za bar byed ces smod par byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: dge slong dag kun dga' ra ba'i nang na 'dus shing za bar byed ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They are eating in the monastery together.”

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /
translated: They criticized and complained and spread it about.🔽The monks heard the criticism of those people.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported to the Blessed One what those people had said.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snga ma bzhin du /

analyzed: 'dus shing za na dus ma gtogs te ltung byed do // de la dus mi 'di yin te /

original: na ba dus so //
analyzed: na ba dus so //
translated: when sick;

original: las dus so //🔽lam dus so //
analyzed: las dus so // lam dus so //
translated: when working;🔽when traveling;

original: grur zhugs pa dus so //
analyzed: grur zhugs pa dus so //

original: 'dus pa chen po dus so //
analyzed: 'dus pa chen po dus so //

original: dge sbyong gi zas dus te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi zas dus te /

original: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bca' ba mdzad de /

original: yul ni rgyal po'i khab /

translated: The place is Rājagṛha.

original: gang zag ni lhas byin 'khor dang bcas pa /

original: nyon mongs pa ni mi mthun pa'i 'dod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni mi mthun pa'i 'dod pa /
translated: The affliction is the desire to be disagreeable.

original: nyes pa ni 'dus shing za ba'o //

original: 'di'i byed pa po na dus su rung ba'i zas bca' ba lnga dang bza' ba lnga po dag nyid gsog 'jog tu gyur pa de nyid la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //

original: 'di la yan lag bzhis dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te dus su rung ba'i zas bca' ba 'am bza' bar gtogs pa dang gsog 'jog tu gyur pa dang der 'du shes pa dang zos pa'o //

analyzed: nye dgas kyang nyi ma re re zhing sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun spyan 'dren par 'gyur ro // 'di ltar bkren ba 'di la ci bdog gis deng la khyim bdag che ge mo'i khyim nas 'o ma long shig che ge mo'i khyim nas zho long shig / che ge mo'i khyim nas mar long shig / che ge mo'i khyim nas nya long shig / che ge

analyzed: mo'i khyim nas sha long shig / che ge mo'i khyim nas sha skam dag long shig ces de dag gis bdag nyid kyi phyir /

Go to such-and-such a house and get butter. Go to such-and-such a house and get fish. Go to such-and-such a house and get meat. Go to such-and-such a house and get dried meat. For their own sake,

analyzed: zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te zos nas gtsug lag khang du dong ba dang / dge slong rnams kyis de dag la smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag khyed kyis zan gar zos /

analyzed: de nyid du'o //

analyzed: khyed cag de nam mthong ngo //

analyzed: kho bo cag phyis lhags so //

analyzed: 'o ma dang zho dang mar dang / nya dang sha dang sha skam dag zos so //
translated: “Milk, yogurt, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat.”

analyzed: kho bo cag gis zas de lta bu ma thob bo //

analyzed: drug sde dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: bkren pa de la zas de lta bu ga la yod /

original: kho bo cag gis khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim dag nas blangs te der zos so //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis khyim du 'gro ba'i khyim dag nas blangs te der zos so //

analyzed: khyed cag bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa de lta bu dag / gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te zar rung ngam /

analyzed: mi rung yang srid de /

analyzed: kho bo cag gis ltogs te 'chi bar bya'am zhes zer nas / dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag bdag nyid kyi phyir /

analyzed: zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te 'cha' ba dang / za bar byed ces smod par byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /

analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de /

analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyi zas bsod pa gang dag gsungs pa 'di lta ste /

analyzed: zas bsod pa de lta bu dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te @167a * //

original: 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: 'cha' 'am za na ltung byed do zhes bca' ba mdzad de /

original: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /
analyzed: yul ni ser skya'i gnas /

original: gang zag ni drug sde /
analyzed: gang zag ni drug sde /

original: nyon mongs pa ni rang nyam dang lto 'dun /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni rang nyam dang lto 'dun /

analyzed: nyes pa ni mi na bar bdag nyid kyi phyir zas bsod pa dag gzhan gyi khyim dag nas blangs te za ba'o // de la bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //🔽dge slong rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so // dge slong rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this regard, the Blessed One is the one who has gone thus, the one who has conquered the enemies, the one who has completely and perfectly awakened.

original: chos 'di pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams kyi'o //

original: zas bsod pa gang dag gsungs pa zhas bya ba ni rab tu bstan pa'o /
analyzed: zas bsod pa gang dag gsungs pa zhas bya ba ni rab tu bstan pa'o /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / nya sha dang / sha dang / sha skam dag ste zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: zas bsod pa dag go // dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am /

analyzed: bdag nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la bsngos te'o //

original: zas bsod pa de lta bu dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: zas bsod pa de lta bu dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Such good food” means

analyzed: 'o ma dang / zho dang / mar dang / nya sha dang / sha dang / sha skam dag go //
translated: milk, yogurt, butter, fish, meat, and dried meat.

analyzed: gzhan gyi khyim dag nas zhes bya ba ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim dag nas so //

analyzed: bslangs te zhes bya ba ni slong mo byas pa'o //

analyzed: 'cha' 'am za na zhes bya ba ni mgul du mid na'o //

analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //

analyzed: nya sha'am / sha'am /

analyzed: sha skam lta bu rang gis bslangs te zos pa dang / ngan pa'am /

analyzed: bsod pa'am / tha mal pa'am / bzang po thob pa na zas bsod pa snga ma dag lta bu rang gis bslangs te zos na /

analyzed: bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /

analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /

original: dge slong mi na ba nyid dang / ji bder bstabs pa ma byas pa nyid dang / zas bsod pa nyid dang / sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim bdag nyid @167b dang ; bslangs te zos pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong mi na ba nyid dang / ji bder bstabs pa ma byas pa nyid dang / zas bsod pa nyid dang / sbyin par byed pa nye du ma yin pa khyim bdag nyid @167b dang ; bslangs te zos pa'o //
translated: the monk is not sick, he has not been served as much as he wishes, the food is good, the layperson who is giving the food is not a relative, and he eats the food after requesting it.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is missing, the downfall is a serious transgression.

analyzed: bsod pa slong ba'i ltung byed de bzhi bcu pa'o /
